t: The Blessedness of Dwelling in the House of God
To the Chief Musician. On an instrument of Gath. A Psalm of the sons of Korah.
How*pn lovely is*i Your tabernacle, O*ld Lord*s of hosts!
My*ld soul longs, yes, even faints For*ld the courts of the Lord;*s My*ld heart and my flesh cry out for the living God.
Even*ln the sparrow has found a home, And*ld the swallow a nest for herself, Where*ld she may lay her youngâ€” Even*ild Your altars, O Lord*s of hosts, My*ld King and my God.
Blessed*ld are*i those who dwell in Your house; They*ld will still be praising You. Selah*ipg
Blessed*pn is*i the man whose strength is*i in You, Whose*ld heart is*i set on pilgrimage.
As*ild they*i pass through the Valley of Baca, They*ld make it a spring; The*ld rain also covers it with pools.
They*ld go from strength to strength; Each*ild one*i appears before God in Zion.
O*ln Lord*s God of hosts, hear my prayer; Give*ld ear, O God of Jacob! Selah*ipg
O*ld God, behold our shield, And*ld look upon the face of Your anointed.
For*ln a day in Your courts is*i better than a thousand. I*ld would rather be a doorkeeper in the house of my God Than*ld dwell in the tents of wickedness.
For*ld the Lord*s God is*i a sun and shield; The*ld Lord*s will give grace and glory; No*ld good thing*i will He withhold From*ld those who walk uprightly.
O*ln Lord*s of hosts, Blessed*ld is*i the man who trusts in You!
